importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The announcement date of the Netflix series 'Kennedy' indicates when the streaming platform revealed the new drama, signaling public interest and media coverage in the Kennedy family's portrayal on television.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, covering the formative years of the Kennedy family, including Joe and Rose Kennedy's rise and the early lives of their children, especially Jack, who later becomes president.

keyTakeAways: A new Netflix series titled 'Kennedy' is set to debut, based on Fredrik Logevall's biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956.'
Michael Fassbender stars as Joe Kennedy, Sr., portraying the patriarch of the Kennedy family in a drama that explores both triumphs and tragedies.
The series begins in the 1930s and chronicles the family's rise, including the struggles of Jack Kennedy to escape the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy.
The show is described as a modern American mythology, blending historical depth with personal drama, offering insight into how political dynasties shape national identity.
The series is distinct from the upcoming Ryan Murphy-produced 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr., avoiding overlap in narrative focus.
The show will run for eight episodes and has not yet been released, with no official release date provided.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is central to the article, as it centers on the Kennedy family and their history, using real historical events to explore American political and cultural mythology.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is cast as Joe Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy family, making him a key figure in the narrative and drawing attention due to his international fame.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He wrote the source book for the series, 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956,' providing historical authenticity and depth to the narrative.

namedEntities.name: JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It serves as the basis for the series, offering a nuanced, biographical account of the Kennedy family's early years and their impact on American history.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the showrunner who described the series as a blend of American mythology and historical insight, shaping the narrative direction and tone.

namedEntities.name: Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central character in the series, representing the foundation of the Kennedy dynasty and the family's rise in American politics and society.

namedEntities.name: Rose Kennedy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is part of the Kennedy family's core, with the series focusing on her and Joe’s journey in raising nine children, including Jack and Robert F. Kennedy.

namedEntities.name: Jack Kennedy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a key character, struggling to escape the shadow of his older brother Robert, and later becomes the 35th U.S. president, central to the family's political legacy.

namedEntities.name: Robert F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is one of the children featured in the series, highlighting the family's political ambitions and tragic end as a senator and presidential hopeful.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His death in a plane crash in 1999 is referenced as part of the Kennedy family’s tragic legacy, reinforcing the 'curse' narrative often discussed in popular culture.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is associated with a separate upcoming series, 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr., helping to distinguish this new series from existing narratives.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The platform is announcing the series, signaling a major cultural event in media and highlighting its role in bringing historical drama to global audiences.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography of the Kennedy family, set to star Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr. The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, exploring the family’s rise and internal conflicts, including Jack’s struggle to escape his brother Robert’s shadow. The show is described as a blend of American mythology and historical truth, offering insight into how political dynasties shape national identity. It will consist of eight episodes and is distinct from a planned Ryan Murphy series about JFK Jr. The announcement underscores the enduring cultural fascination with the Kennedy family, known for both their political legacy and tragic events.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
